intro: Conostylis drummondii, commonly known as the Drummond's conostylis, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Poaceae, commonly known as the grass family. The plant is characterized by its tufted growth habit and produces small, pale blue or white flowers in dense spikes. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Conostylis drummondii is often found in open habitats such as woodlands and shrublands.
